pull.title: Bugfix: Wallet: Soft-fail exceptions within ListWalletDir file checks
pull.body:
Previously, an exception would be thrown, which could kill the node in some circumstances.

Includes test changes to cause failure.

Review with `?w=1`

events.body: ACK bca838d38c54f3df3c85da54e23857f06f07c6bb

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #20275 (wallet: List SQLite wallets in non-SQLite builds by ryanofsky)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
ACK 4f0cbc4
Code review ACK 4f0cbc4bc74dd87bc187fb839218b1fa64cfb205
I've reviewed 4f0cbc4bc74dd87bc187fb839218b1fa64cfb205 and ready to ACK after rebasing.
Rebased
ACK 1e77a8d5a4faa0757e53e0284662b249eebc3ef7, I have reviewed the code and it looks OK, I agree it can be merged.

re-ACK 1e77a8d5a4faa0757e53e0284662b249eebc3ef7

In the new test, the new exception prints:

[httpworker.1] ListWalletDir: Error scanning /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_ql5k4c0f/node0/regtest/wallets/self_walletdat_symlink: boost::filesystem::status: Too many levels of symbolic links: "/tmp/bitcoin_func_test_ql5k4c0f/node0/regtest/wallets/self_walletdat_symlink/wallet.dat"

[httpworker.1] ListWalletDir: Error scanning /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_ql5k4c0f/node0/regtest/wallets/self_walletdat_symlink/wallet.dat: boost::filesystem::status: Too many levels of symbolic links: "/tmp/bitcoin_func_test_ql5k4c0f/node0/regtest/wallets/self_walletdat_symlink/wallet.dat"`

nit: Before merge please note; this  ( #19502 and  ( #20080  or #19933 ) should merged together, since they vice versa would create new issues, like shorted wallet names.

If we have boost cononical best first #20080 and then this.
I don't see what new issues (aside from rebasing) would be created by merging them separately?

> I don't see what new issues (aside from rebasing) would be created by merging them separately?

iirc this a fix for the boost link problem and  ( evil wallet ) and makes #18095 obsolete.  

But if this get merged first, then real short filenames wallets from the later found bug could be created from a bogus dirname on disk for real.
re-utACK 1e77a8d5a4faa0757e53e0284662b249eebc3ef7
Rebased again

~re-ACK 9f74b7b3beba182d3b3118bf331515ef6e5ffcf2~, only rebased since my [previous](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19502#pullrequestreview-506748519) review, verified with `git range-diff master 1e77a8d5a 9f74b7b3b`.

Revoked. See https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19502#issuecomment-713165606

I revoke my ACK as this change makes possible an infinity loop.
To reproduce the bug, one could create a directory without access permissions, e.g.:
```
$ ls -l /home/hebasto/bitcoin-data-dir/wallets
total 1456
drwx------ 3 hebasto hebasto    4096 Oct  3 11:16 20191109-main
drwx------ 2 root    root       4096 Oct 20 23:58 crash
-rw-r--r-- 1 hebasto hebasto       0 Mar  5  2020 db.log
drwx------ 3 hebasto hebasto    4096 Oct 20 23:56 w20201015.bdb
drwx------ 3 hebasto hebasto    4096 Oct 20 23:56 w20201015.desc
-rw-r----- 1 hebasto hebasto 1474560 Sep 12 16:08 wallet.dat
```

I suggest to combine into this PR the approach from #18095: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/6904a309194c7ddf5a071d43e6c2bf892e8fe396/src/wallet/walletutil.cpp#L42-L53
with credits to @uhliksk
@hebasto Couldn't reproduce, but it did cause listwallets to miss other wallets. Added a fix and test.

Tested 49cc6919c4f9ef5a33ad5948a1b43496b454fab0, still able to reproduce an infinite loop:
```
cd <path-to-wallet-dir>
sudo mkdir crash
sudo chown 0700 crash
```

then start a node, and initiate a `ListWalletDir` call in any way.

Approach ACK 44c0bc31f4fadc932877d9764402644c84f3be4c, tested on Linux Mint 20 (x86_64).

Instead of an [infinite loop](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19502#issuecomment-719004065) having a nice log message:
```
2020-10-29T20:41:26Z [main] ListWalletDir: Error scanning /home/hebasto/.bitcoin/testnet3/wallets/crash: boost::filesystem::status: Permission denied: "/home/hebasto/.bitcoin/testnet3/wallets/crash/wallet.dat"
```

Keeping reviewing the last commit.

events.message: Bugfix: Wallet: Soft-fail exceptions within ListWalletDir file checks
QA: wallet_multiwallet: Check that recursive symlink directory and wallet.dat loops are ignored

events.body: re-ACK 24d2d3341d07509ad3f37bb6f130446ad20ac807, rebased only since my [previous](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19502#pullrequestreview-520552944) review.

Tested ACK 24d2d3341d07509ad3f37bb6f130446ad20ac807, test change fails on master.

nit, could squash.
utACK 24d2d3341d07509ad3f37bb6f130446ad20ac807

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -50,6 +50,11 @@ def wallet_file(name):
         os.mkdir(wallet_dir('w7'))
         os.symlink('w7', wallet_dir('w7_symlink'))
 
+        os.symlink('..', wallet_dir('recursive_dir_symlink'))
+
+        os.mkdir(wallet_dir('self_walletdat_symlink'))
+        os.symlink('wallet.dat', wallet_dir('self_walletdat_symlink/wallet.dat'))
comments.body:
Verified that this does cause the test to fail at line 79 without the changes in this PR.

Could also assert that the new logging is taking place with this at line 79 or just after:
```python3
with self.nodes[0].assert_debug_log(expected_msgs=['Too many levels of symbolic links', 'Error scanning']):
    self.nodes[0].listwalletdir()['wallets']
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -50,6 +50,11 @@ def wallet_file(name):
         os.mkdir(wallet_dir('w7'))
         os.symlink('w7', wallet_dir('w7_symlink'))
 
+        os.symlink('..', wallet_dir('recursive_dir_symlink'))
+
+        os.mkdir(wallet_dir('self_walletdat_symlink'))
+        os.symlink('wallet.dat', wallet_dir('self_walletdat_symlink/wallet.dat'))
comments.body:
(or combined with the existing line 79 to share the same listwalletdir call)
```diff
-        assert_equal(sorted(map(lambda w: w['name'], self.nodes[0].listwalletdir()['wallets'])), ['', os.path.join('sub', 'w5'), 'w', 'w1', 'w2', 'w3', 'w7', 'w7_symlink', 'w8'])
+        with self.nodes[0].assert_debug_log(expected_msgs=['Too many levels of symbolic links', 'Error scanning']):
+            list = self.nodes[0].listwalletdir()['wallets']
+        assert_equal(sorted(map(lambda w: w['name'], list)), ['', os.path.join('sub', 'w5'), 'w', 'w1', 'w2', 'w3', 'w7', 'w7_symlink', 'w8'])
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -109,7 +115,16 @@ def wallet_file(name):
             self.nodes[0].createwallet(wallet_name, descriptors=False)
         for wallet_name in wallet_names[-2:]:
             self.nodes[0].loadwallet(wallet_name)
-        assert_equal(sorted(map(lambda w: w['name'], self.nodes[0].listwalletdir()['wallets'])), [self.default_wallet_name, os.path.join('sub', 'w5'), 'w', 'w1', 'w2', 'w3', 'w7', 'w7_symlink', 'w8'])
+
+        os.mkdir(wallet_dir('no_access'))
+        os.chmod(wallet_dir('no_access'), 0)
comments.body:
44c0bc31f4fadc932877d9764402644c84f3be4c

If this line is commented out, the test still passing.

-        assert_equal(sorted(map(lambda w: w['name'], self.nodes[0].listwalletdir()['wallets'])), [self.default_wallet_name, os.path.join('sub', 'w5'), 'w', 'w1', 'w2', 'w3', 'w7', 'w7_symlink', 'w8'])

         for wallet_name in wallet_names[-2:]:
             self.nodes[0].loadwallet(wallet_name)
-        assert_equal(sorted(map(lambda w: w['name'], self.nodes[0].listwalletdir()['wallets'])), [self.default_wallet_name, os.path.join('sub', 'w5'), 'w', 'w1', 'w2', 'w3', 'w7', 'w7_symlink', 'w8'])
+

+        os.chmod(wallet_dir('no_access'), 0)
comments.body: If initial state is changed, i.e., the `no_access` directory actually has access, the test should fail, right?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -109,7 +115,16 @@ def wallet_file(name):
             self.nodes[0].createwallet(wallet_name, descriptors=False)
         for wallet_name in wallet_names[-2:]:
             self.nodes[0].loadwallet(wallet_name)
-        assert_equal(sorted(map(lambda w: w['name'], self.nodes[0].listwalletdir()['wallets'])), [self.default_wallet_name, os.path.join('sub', 'w5'), 'w', 'w1', 'w2', 'w3', 'w7', 'w7_symlink', 'w8'])
+
+        os.mkdir(wallet_dir('no_access'))
+        os.chmod(wallet_dir('no_access'), 0)
comments.body:
No, it's just there to make sure it doesn't break things. We're testing bitcoind, not the OS...

(And in fact, chmod won't work to deny read access on Windows)
